citation.article-title: Rubidibacter lacunae gen. nov., sp. nov., a unicellular, phycoerythrin-containing cyanobacterium isolated from seawater of Chuuk lagoon, Micronesia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Rubidibacter (Ru.bi.di.bac′ter. L. adj. rubidus red, reddish; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Rubidibacter red-coloured rod).
Non-motile, unicellular rods and oxygenic photoautotroph.
Reproduction occurs by transverse binary fission in a single plane.
Do not produce well-defined sheath layers.
Contain phycoerythrin and photosynthetic thylakoids located peripherally.
Contain zeaxanthin, β-carotene and echinenone as major carotenoid pigments.
The type species is Rubidibacter lacunae sp. nov.
